body_html:
$ bazel version
Build label: 0.17.2
Build target: bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Fri Sep 21 10:31:42 2018 (1537525902)
Build timestamp: 1537525902
Build timestamp as int: 1537525902

# Linux Mint 18.2:
$ uname -a
Linux precision 4.15.0-34-generic #37~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Aug 28 10:44:06 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

I'm not purposely using cuda, but it looks like I do have libcuda installed, could that affect things?

$ dpkg -l | grep -i cuda
ii  libcuda1-384                                384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1                                amd64        NVIDIA CUDA runtime library

Checking my apt history my last gcc upgrade was 2018-09-30 07:01:36, so long before that bazel run... and again the weird thing is previous bazel builds ran fine... it was just that one run after switching branches which added the errant option and required an expunge.

Oh well, the reality is this isn't reproducible at the moment, so impossible to effectively debug. If I do hit it again anywhere in particular I should look to help debug? You mentioned autodetected crosstool above, anywhere else?

$ bazel version
Build label: 0.17.2
Build target: bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Fri Sep 21 10:31:42 2018 (1537525902)
Build timestamp: 1537525902
Build timestamp as int: 1537525902

# Linux Mint 18.2:
$ uname -a
Linux precision 4.15.0-34-generic #37~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Aug 28 10:44:06 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

I'm not purposely using cuda, but it looks like I do have libcuda installed, could that affect things?
$ dpkg -l | grep -i cuda
ii  libcuda1-384                                384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1                                amd64        NVIDIA CUDA runtime library

Checking my apt history my last gcc upgrade was 2018-09-30  07:01:36, so long before that bazel run... and again the weird thing is previous bazel builds ran fine... it was just that one run after switching branches which added the errant option and required an expunge.
Oh well, the reality is this isn't reproducible at the moment, so impossible to effectively debug.  If I do hit it again anywhere in particular I should look to help debug?  You mentioned autodetected crosstool above, anywhere else?
body:
```
$ bazel version
Build label: 0.17.2
Build target: bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Fri Sep 21 10:31:42 2018 (1537525902)
Build timestamp: 1537525902
Build timestamp as int: 1537525902

# Linux Mint 18.2:
$ uname -a
Linux precision 4.15.0-34-generic #37~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Aug 28 10:44:06 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

I'm not purposely using cuda, but it looks like I do have libcuda installed, could that affect things?

```
$ dpkg -l | grep -i cuda
ii  libcuda1-384                                384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1                                amd64        NVIDIA CUDA runtime library
```

Checking my apt history my last gcc upgrade was 2018-09-30  07:01:36, so long before that bazel run... and again the weird thing is previous bazel builds ran fine... it was just that one run after switching branches which added the errant option and required an expunge.

Oh well, the reality is this isn't reproducible at the moment, so impossible to effectively debug.  If I do hit it again anywhere in particular I should look to help debug?  You mentioned autodetected crosstool above, anywhere else?
